newsitem.title: USA: Barnes Group sees record sales/profit for 1997.
newsitem.headline: Barnes Group sees record sales/profit for 1997.

text.p: Barnes Group Inc said Monday it expects to report record-breaking sales and profits for 1997.

"We see the company's momentum continuing through the second half of 1997," Barnes president and chief executive officer Theodore Martin said in a press release accompanying the company's second quarter earnings.
"We expect 1997 to be the third straight year of record sales and profits for the company," Martin said.

The company said its second quarter results, which rose 23 percent from 1996, were the best of any quarter in its history. It reported net income for quarter of $10,714 million, or $0.53 per share, versus $8,658 million, or $0.43 per share a year ago.
